Reviews.Title: Awesome dual sim phone
Reviews.Author: J.R.
Reviews.Content: I use this for both my Italian and UK sim cards when I'm traveling and even when I'm home in the US.  It works great, looks very chic, and the battery life is very good for such a feature packed phone.  Had a little trouble figuring out the menu (to change ringtones) but eventually navigated my way around it.  The manual that comes with it isn't all that great.  But the phone does its job and does it very well.

Reviews.Title: Good for travel
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I use this phone in the US and Mexico.  Have two sims from different carriers is a real money saver for me and customers.  The menu's can be difficult setting up internet and email. Once it is setup it seems pretty smooth. The phone includes 3mp camera, FM Radio capacitive touch screen (No stylus-iphone, android),wifi and bluetooth. Includes a Microsd slot that can take up to a 32gb card(Tested). The backlight for the keyboard seems uneven but in the dark its fine.  All in all a great phone for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good but quirky controls take some getting used to
Reviews.Author: LinXX MiDoups
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a Motorola EX115 to this model and found it to be both cumbersome and superior in some instances. I am pleased with the quality of the phone and it's overall functionality. Though somewhat quirky when it comes to the menu navigation, it takes some getting used to (but it's not Rocket Science). It surprisingly has a lot of the bells and whistles that come with smart phones these days, WiFi, Bluetooth, handwriting recognition, social networks pre-loaded (and easy to set up and use). Unlike its predecessor, the EX119 does not log calls made to and from each SIM separately; it now aggregates the call log - much like how the EX115 did for text messages - i.e., although it notifies you as to which SIM a call is received from the instant you receive one, it does not separate calls per SIM in its call log. Although if you look close enough, you can see the SIM number from which a call originates indicated beside each call in the log (there is no indicator for messages though). The phone book is central, but with each call or text made out, you are prompted to choose which SIM to use to complete the action. You have the option of using one SIM only if two are installed, or have both of them active. Because it is a Dual-SIM stand-by type phone; when a call is engaged on one SIM(1) and there's an incoming call at the same time to the other SIM(2), that call [on SIM(2)] will go to voice mail (if you have voice mail service i.e.). However, if a call comes in on the SIM that is currently engaged, you will receive the call waiting tone (if you have call waiting service i.e.). Incoming calls can be engaged as they occur and you will see an indication of which SIM the call comes to. It has a basic media player and radio as well as quick-access widgets for both in the new tile styled menu (which also has various display options to choose from), WAP, calender, calculator, currency converter, a (watered down but useful) unit converter, reminders, notes, alarms and profiles (where you can set a different general ring tone and message tones for each SIM and /or/ each contact). It's pretty cool and VERY VERY light and small!!

Reviews.Title: Best Dual SIM phone
Reviews.Author: Sohrab
Reviews.Content: Checked and researched.. as a second phone to carry around, it has an excellent battery life and reception worldwide. What tipped the balance in favor of Motorola was the micro usb charging port - now I don't need to carry more cables. When will other phone manufacturers learn?It is not a smartphone so the interface needs some learning - but this boosts the battery life to a week sometimes without charging and limited use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent:)
Reviews.Author: Valentino B
Reviews.Content: This is the best phone  for the price, I live in Costa Rica, it works awesome here, is fast, thin, light and it has a very cool design, I like the combination between Qwerty keyboard and the touchscreen, I have never seen a cellphone like this, Motorola is the best brand if you're searching a 150$ or less  cellphone.Also the internet is very good, it's fast...touchscreen is excellent not like others that are very hard..I recommend this product to anyone that want a good cellphone between 100$ and 200$ , I am very happy with this model .

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: fjcerni
Reviews.Content: Great phone! deliverd was as planned, and phone works great for USD 100!!! good image, video, wifi, dual sim, international, unlocked, etc. really good deal

Reviews.Title: Motorola EX119 Changing Language Back to English
Reviews.Author: CIP 101 "Air_Traveler"
Reviews.Content: I decided to write this review because my phone has English and Thai and one day it switched into Thai Language (squiggly scripting text) and I had to go to a Thai Restaurant to find an interpreter.  So to help others out here is how to get to the language screen to switch back to English.1. Click on Settings (Gear Icon main menu screen)2. Click on Number Three (3 on left side) = Phone settings3. Click on Number Three (3 on left side) = Language4. Next Screen Toggle English which is the top line5. Hit Save, the check mark button, and you should be back in English modeOn my side, put a little sticky note on the battery so not to forget, better than trips to find an interpretor!  Otherwise Great Phone!

Reviews.Title: BEST BUY!!
Reviews.Author: LatexCartman
Reviews.Content: DOES NOT REQUIRE DATA PACKAGE WITH AT&T;The phone works really well and it was shipped overnight.I have had the phone for about a week and I have nothing but great things to say about it!!

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly in Venezuela
Reviews.Author: Eliaquin
Reviews.Content: This is a very good phone for the price. The 3 Gb camera is very wood, the software is very fast and the mix between touch screen and a non touch QUERTY keyboard is awesome.If you are thinking to buy a cellphone just to surf in the web, check your e-mails and the other cellphones regular fuunction such as sms and calls, this is a very good cellphone and perfect for its low price.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Leandro Job
Reviews.Content: This phone is very good, except for configurations of ringtones. You can't change the ringtone of messages, and you can only run 1 java aplication per time.But the other functions are good, and it correspond to my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Started junky, became junk
Reviews.Author: Michael Fumento
Reviews.Content: Never really worked. Could make calls, but I literally never received one. SOMETHING was always set wrong no matter how many times I reset it. Current situation is that under the "personalize" menu there was ONLY silent mode. Accidentally clicked on it and that was that. There were no other options! Couldn't take it out of silent mode. When I contacted tech support by chat I was told that then that must be how the phone was designed! I would hope not! Well now I can't even access the personalize menu. Just doesn't appear. So I figured I'd try factory reset. No, can't do that either. Need to enter my password. Problem is, I never SET a password! They should rename the model "Catch-22." No matter what you try, it stays a step ahead of you to prevent it.If this is YOUR idea of a fun time, go for it. I want a PHONE.

Reviews.Title: Good quality but terrible interface
Reviews.Author: O. Oleynikov "food experimenter"
Reviews.Content: I have long held this opinion about Motorola products - their hardware quality is really great (nice to touch, good design etc.), but their software division is run by aliens!For the life of me I can NEVER understand their interfaces - extremely unintuitive, inconvenient sometimes to a point of utter frustration.I had major doubts before buying this phone, but after reading many good reviews on EX119 I decided to take a leap of faith that Motorola has finally created something usable.Now I have come to regret my decision.  I bought this phone for my wife, since she lost her old Motorola (which neither of us liked anyway).Again, I totally agree with everyone's reviews about the excellent quality of this phone (touchscreen, buttons, the case etc.), but unless you have a special craving for masochistic UI's, don't buy this phone.  Where to begin?- No buttons to place and end a call (despite a full QWERTY keyboard!)- I could not find out how to listen to ringtones while editing contacts - had to call from my phone to just listen how it rings.  C'mon now!- Could not send any contacts from my Blackberry to this phone (tried e-mailing, SMS, Bluetooth - nada)- There is ENTER/OK key, but no BACK/ESC button - have to use the touchscreen- The camera can be activated only after accessing it from buried 2 levels deep in a menu - forget about taking quick pictures when you need them- The touchscreen goes to locked mode on its own all the time (why can't I just leave it unlocked?)- The overall menu navigation is so convoluted and geeky it is hard to believe. For example, the menu for configuring SIM is called UART Settings!!! (For those who does not know what UART means - in computer lingo it stands for Universal Asynchronous Receiver-Transmitter and is generally referred to serial ports on computers)- The list goes on...I have owned several Motorola phones (mobile and landline) and every one of them had unusable user interface.I should have listened to my inner voice telling me that I should trust my first impressions and not fall for this phone.  Well, it makes calls and generally works, so I guess I will have to suck it up and use it until it's dead.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: R. DAY
Reviews.Content: Works with t-mobile/USA.  Clear calls.  Opera/WiFi. Does not work with t-mobile t-zones or t-mobile data network.  If you need a 4G network and want to pay for a big data plan don't buy this phone.  If you want to check your e-mail and the news, it's perfect.  Keyboard is very nice and so is the touch screen.  No complaints just what I wanted and needed.

Reviews.Title: Working good
Reviews.Author: Elchin
Reviews.Content: Good price for this product.Camera good,sense of screen good....Quick shipping,recomended.Item was new unopend box. (phone is made in china,but original)

Reviews.Title: Exelent phone
Reviews.Author: Elias Luna
Reviews.Content: It does the work ... it works fine with the 2 sim cards at the same time.Is very thin and his querty keyboard is very confortable to use.good phone nice battery time

Reviews.Title: Great Product for the Dual SIM line...
Reviews.Author: C. Farrington
Reviews.Content: I have had multiple Dual Sim phones, this is the best one yet.  Cost is great too.  Under $100 and sold on Amazon, can't beat that.Pros.  Light, slim, really nice looking.  Fully functional with all the buttons, and pretty intuitive.  The touch screen is suprisingly high quality.  It has only been a week, but no problems.  I like that the buttons still work though as well.  Very vivid and sharp screen.  Fully functional for my basic needs of having a phone that can carry both SIMs for the cell providers in Nicaragua.  When you cross call here you get destroyed.  So instead of carrying two phones that would reach $100 I have this very nice one for the same price.Cons. I prefer a Sim1 & Sim2 button for phone calls.  But they seem to have stopped producing phones like that.  You have to hit a couple buttons to get to the call, similar to the annoyance on smart phones like the iPhone.  But this has no "favorites" list for most frequently called (or I haven't found it yet).  Also the display of the phone book is a small annoyance. (it only fits two on the screen at a time, so scrolling down it always necessary).  If you type to reach your contact your first click activates the feature then you have to spell...I am constantly starting spelling on the first click then having to delete characters and start over, annoying for making calls to ones not on the recent call list.Those are small complaints really.  Everything about this phone is great, especially for the price.  Like I said it has only been a week, so it might explode.  But has been great.Thanks Amazon.  Thanks Market Seller HassleFreeSell.

Reviews.Title: Miserable device..must have been programmed by an idiot
Reviews.Author: subsea
Reviews.Content: I am only using it because I am waiting for another phone. I have had the overwhelming desire to slam it on the floor and smash it with my foot. I had such a good experience with my A1200.. I am surprised Motorola let this piece of crap get out the door.

Reviews.Title: very small and light.
Reviews.Author: Walter Delap
Reviews.Content: hard to figure out. the manual is useless, but phone seems to be quite nice for the price! heck of a time figuring out simple things, ie, how to turn on loudspeaker, etc. manual as i said, useless.

Reviews.Title: Very nice hardware spoild with a useless fimware.
Reviews.Author: Pechiar Carlos "CH!"
Reviews.Content: Design is excellent, very appealing.But I do not understand how did the firmware design went through over to production. I am a fan of Motorola phones but I guess this will be the last one. In fact, I have already bought something else to replace it.The fact that it is intended to fall in the inexpensive category of phones is NOT an excuse for this.Another thing that I do not understand is a phone that does not have the ability to sync the contacts with a computer or other device.It is obvious that when you buy a phone you already had an older phone full of contacts and that the phone that you are buying will NOT be the last phone you buy. Ultimately the real value is in the information and not in the hardware. If I knew that I was not able to sync my contacts I would not have bought the phone.

Reviews.Title: No MMS and not enough directions
Reviews.Author: Ben's Mom
Reviews.Content: This phone is just okay. The first one had to be returned within the first few weeks when the power button stopped working. The problem I have is that it will not send or open received MMS messages or pictures. MMS is activated on my AT&T; plan but this phone will not open them. (AT&T; will not help me because I did not buy the phone from them and the Motorola support site for AT&T; was closed down at the same time I purchased this phone.) The lack of any manual other than the very basics has kept me from using most of the features. Not being a "digital native" I'm not able to figure out most of the other functions. I use it for phone calls and regular texting but miss out on group texts and pictures that people send me.

Reviews.Title: love the phone
Reviews.Author: Chris G
Reviews.Content: bought it for use overseas, it works great, the dual sims are a real money saver, we take it to south America and Europe regularly and if performs quite well

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: L. BROWN "legend"
Reviews.Content: Waste of money didn't work properly with my carrier as far as going on the net. The phone wasnt keeping accurate date and time no matter how much time you fix it. The phone was not able to lock for security

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Nasrin    Mohseni
Reviews.Content: This phone was great, small and easy to work with. is a really perfect secondary phone because of the two sim cards.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Pros: lightweight, price, features (wifi,b/tooth,touch screen).Cons: took a little while to figure out all the features.I love this phone, it exceeded my expectations.Nb. In order to type *120 etc... disable wifi

Reviews.Title: Too confusing to navigate
Reviews.Author: Hard2please
Reviews.Content: The phone does not work to my expectations, and some times I can not answer the calls coming in.  I have not start using it for a month yet and the phone not responding to my touch of the menu. I noticed that the dual Sim does not work simultaneously AND SOME OF THE FEATURES,IS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH MY NETWORK ESPECIALLY TRANSFERRING MONEY FROM ONE PREPIAD ACCOUNT TO ANOTHER.

Reviews.Title: What I wanted
Reviews.Author: Juan Burbano
Reviews.Content: The mobile is great, is exactly the thing it was described. Please mind the mobile software language is THai language or English. There is not more choices

Reviews.Title: I Like It
Reviews.Author: keschellekens
Reviews.Content: I like the simplicity of the phone. If you're a big internet user then this isn't for you do to the small screen, but since I just want this for texting it is perfect for me. The battery life is great; I am on day three without charging so far. It's simple and using and I enjoy the light-weight, thin exterior. I works very well for me as an individual.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Waldo Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: This cell phone filled my expectations, I needed a dual sim phone and it works perfectly. The wi-fi has good range, fast navigation, not bad for a low-cost smart phone, I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: took some getting used to
Reviews.Author: Mary A. Phillips
Reviews.Content: I have come to like this phone but it took some getting used to.  The manual included in the shipping is not at all helpful in getting it figured out and this was my first "smart phone."  Now that I've had it for a month I really like it.  I love the dual sim feature because I travel between the U.S. and Mexico.  Now I can leave both sims in and choose which one I want to make a call or text from.  The camera is good.  All in all it's pretty easy to use now that I've figured out how to use it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: JeffSmith
Reviews.Content: I got it as a gift for my girlfriend in Africa where they have two networks. It takes nice pictures. The videoing is not as nice, but do not let that discourage you!

Reviews.Title: Scrunched screen
Reviews.Author: Okodugba
Reviews.Content: The phone isn't bad, not great on signal strength. My biggest problem is the size of the screen, it would have been better if it was larger.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work completely on AT&T; network
Reviews.Author: AL
Reviews.Content: This is an adequate basic phone, but I couldn't get MMS to work on the AT&T; network. Spent much time with an AT&T; rep, who concluded the phone just couldn't access the AT&T; data network. Not clear if it's this specific handset, or a wider problem, but you might want to avoid it if you're on AT&T.; I can send texts (SMS) without problem, but not picture messages (MMS).Touchscreen is fine, keyboard is pretty basic. Would be nice to have "send" and "end call" buttons on the keypad, rather than having to access them through the touch screen. FM radio was fine--not super audio, but decent for the price of this phone.I wouldn't buy it again, because I want to be able to use MMS, but this might work for some.

Reviews.Title: Not for me
Reviews.Author: Roy Ames
Reviews.Content: I liked it a lot at first, but after about six months it became very soft and hard to hear and I had to get something else.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Hanna
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone looking to use in in Canada with a canadian sim card. The phone worked great. Good quality and quick delivery.

Reviews.Title: Good Dual sim
Reviews.Author: Andres Betancourt
Reviews.Content: Slim Phone, big screen, great response... is not an android but it works for me.... include twitter and the menus are easy to config.good for the price..

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive but Efficient
Reviews.Author: Blessed
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone a few weeks ago. I did not receive it in the time frame inwhich I paid for it to be delivered. However I received the phone and it was what I expected. So far I am pleased although it took some time to set the ringtones. It is a great phone for the price. I'm sure it will meet my needed functions.

Reviews.Title: Does the job, touchscreen issues came quick tough
Reviews.Author: Danillo Cardoso
Reviews.Content: For the price you pay it's good enough. Even though the touchscreen on the extreme top that gives access to a drop down menu isn't working anymore.

Reviews.Title: Genuine?
Reviews.Author: Harp
Reviews.Content: Upon initial power up (after a full charge), I noticed immediately that the keys were lit unevenly. This struck me as extremely odd. I then placed a phone call and the call quality was terrible. You could hear an echo of your conversation with a delay of a second or two. Very distracting and the voice quality was poor. I don't really think that Motorola would manufacture such a cheap product. I returned the phone and was very pleased with the service.

Reviews.Title: Elegant and simple
Reviews.Author: Clarity143
Reviews.Content: replaced my EX115, works perfectly, need to figure out how to send and receive MMS from this phone, since it is an unlocked phone unsupported by T-mobile USA, there must be a setting, but Motorola website (USA) EX119 is not represented there

Reviews.Title: great value!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: KelvinDuong
Reviews.Content: Received the phone today, placed an order with WirelessEverything just 2 day ago. shipping was extremely fast. beat the estimated delivery by 4 days. phone work great. signal is much better than my current Samsung. the only down side is that the phone did not have the receive and reject call button. However, the phone is pretty awesome. the operating system is quite easy to use and it allow pretty much all the customizations you can think of for a basic phone. able to load mp3 file through the data cable ( does not come with it) and set it as ring tone. recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for the price...
Reviews.Author: Vicky
Reviews.Content: After reading som eof the reviews I was a little worried but the phone is great. It is very slim and "pretty" and quite functional.The brightness of the screen does not auto adjust but you can do it manually if you want. And you can change the ringtone of the messages, you have to go to the little arrow on the top of the main menu, then profile and you can set any rogntone you want to each profile... Works with Opera, not great but I guess I don't mind...Deserves a chance.

Reviews.Title: f Motorola EX119 BLK/WHT Unlocked Dual-Sim Phone with QWERTY Keyboard, FM Radio, 3 MP Camera and Bluetooth
Reviews.Author: Luis Anderson
Reviews.Content: Una buena esperiencia, el objeto en buen estado, como estaba en la descripción, me llego en la fecha estimada, vinieron con todos los accesorios

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: belize88
Reviews.Content: I purchased this item on Amazon after seeing it in a local store here in Belize. Found it online for $150 cheaper. It came brand new and works perfectly! Has a lot of cool features and the keyboard is surprisingly very easy to use. The buttons are great.

Reviews.Title: good phone except the charger
Reviews.Author: a
Reviews.Content: WELL, you should notice that this nice phone is an international version. so the charger doesnt fit very well. But the service is really good, hope they could send me the charger soon. NICE PHONE!

Reviews.Title: Wrongs Things in Motorola EX119
Reviews.Author: Enigma Dominicano
Reviews.Content: the phone is nice, lightweight and practical, in addition to working with 2 Sim Cards at the same time, but lacks the keys to receive and close calls, which prevents close a line without unlocking the touchscreen.the device also does not have a menu to view the contacts of both Sims, which I consider a software error.

Reviews.Title: SEAL HAS BEEN DAMAGED
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: 1/26/2012I just received it few hours ago.I found that SEAL, tape thingy, has been damaged..the box was open already but inside products were unopened...but the SEAL says "REFUSE THIS PRODUCT IF THE SEAL HAS BEEN DAMAGED" I don't see any problems with it for now..so I don't know if I'll return it or not.and the phone was in Spanish so I needed to change it into English.at the top of the screen it has tiny icon '2x' I wonder if it means 2G network is on...

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: Cris
Reviews.Content: Item is ok, very good, this phone is work fine, i am happy for this product. All functions of this item is ok.

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
Dual SIM card slot
2.4-Inch color display
FM radio
GSM: 850, 900, 1800, 1900
ProductInfo.Name: Motorola EX119 BLK/WHT Unlocked Dual-Sim Phone with QWERTY Keyboard, FM Radio, 3 MP Camera and Bluetooth - International Warranty - Black/White
